scenario_description: Marcus Delgado-Washington (AGENT3) litigation discovery scenario. PEARL mode with emphasis on knowledge provenance and information asymmetry. A trade secret misappropriation case between a biotech startup (plaintiff) and a former employee who joined a competitor (defendant). The core question is who knew what when: when did the defendant access proprietary formulations, what did they take to the new employer, and when did the plaintiff discover the misappropriation? Four entities navigate the discovery timeline with structurally enforced information barriers. Plaintiff counsel cannot reference evidence not yet produced in discovery. Defense counsel knows about documents their client has not disclosed. The witness holds information neither side has obtained through formal mechanisms. The judge learns facts only through admitted exhibits and testimony.

plaintiff_counsel_reeves.role: Plaintiff attorney representing the biotech startup. Discovers evidence through formal discovery only.

defense_counsel_nakamura.role: Defense attorney representing the former employee. Knows what client took but has not disclosed all documents.

witness_dr_patel.role: Former colleague who observed the defendant's last weeks at the startup. Has not been deposed yet.

judge_martinez.role: Federal judge presiding over the case. Only knows what has been formally filed or admitted.

knowledge_provenance_emphasis.description: This template emphasizes M3 knowledge provenance to model legal discovery. Each entity's knowledge state must respect information barriers.
information_barriers: Plaintiff counsel cannot reference documents not yet produced by defense
Defense counsel knows about client documents but has disclosure obligations
Witness knowledge is unavailable until deposition occurs
Judge only receives formally filed motions and admitted exhibits

discovery_timeline.event: Complaint filed. Initial disclosures exchanged. Limited document production.
First round of discovery requests. Defense produces partial documents. Plaintiff deposes witness.
Motion to compel additional documents. Court orders production. Key evidence surfaces.
Summary judgment briefing. All evidence now in record. Information asymmetry partially resolved.
